articles.title: Passage of "Bill on Human Rights of North Korea" Protested
articles.content:
Struggle of WPK Supported 
    Pyongyang, October 3 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Denmark (Marxist-Leninist) will positively support the struggle of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) to smash the U.S. imperialists' threat of aggression and war moves and to achieve national reunification and defend socialism, Jorgen Petersen, chairman of the National Leadership of the party, said when meeting DPRK Ambassador e. p. to Denmark Jon In Chan on September 22.
 The struggle of the WPK against U.S. imperialism is greatly contributing to the defence of peace and security in the Korean peninsula and Asia and greatly encouraging the socialist movement in Denmark and the rest of the world, he said, adding:    
 It is important to further strengthen cooperation and relationship among progressive political parties under the complicated situation of the world.  He stressed that he would make positive efforts to develop the relations with the WPK.

articles.title: Danish Queen Hopes for Developing Relations with DPRK
Stop to U.S. War Provocation Moves Demanded
articles.content:
Danish Queen Hopes for Developing Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, October 3 (KCNA) -- Danish Queen Margrethe II hoped that the relations between Denmark and the DPRK would more favorably develop in the future.
 When receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador e. p. to Denmark Jon In Chan on September 22, she wished the Korean people a new success in their work for prosperity of the country and promotion of welfare.

articles.title: KCNA Urges Japan to Liquidate Past Wrongdoings
articles.content:
Stop to U.S. War Provocation Moves Demanded 
    Pyongyang, October 3 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly made public a statement on September 27, demanding a stop to the U.S. war provocation moves.
 Recalling that the U.S. announced its plan to additionally deploy a lot of war equipment including Aegis destroyers and a nuclear carrier in and around south Korea, the statement charged that it is little short of the declaration of a war against the Korean nation.    
 The statement said that the U.S. should clearly see that it will face the doom of empire before long, immediately stop its war provocation moves and get out of this land.

articles.content:
15th National Program Contest and Exhibition Opens
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- The 15th national program contest and exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition on Friday.
 Displayed there are at least 640 excellent programs developed by scientists, technicians and students in the field of the information science and technology and materials on the successes the Ministry of Electricity and Coal Industries, the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport and other ministries, national institutions and different units have achieved by introducing IT into production and management and administrative and business activities true to leader   Kim Jong Il's idea of giving importance to science and technology.    
 The participants will compete in a variety of applied programs and translation programs, have opportunities to listen to lectures on IT, exchange program technology and get business services to be provided by units in the field of IT.

Kim Yong Nam Greets Cyprian President
    Pyongyang, October 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to President of Cyprus Tassos Papadopoulos on Sept. 30 on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of its independence.
 The message wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of the country and the peaceful solution to the Cyprian issue.
